GSD.description: reel through 0.6.1 allows Request Smuggling attacks due to incorrect Content-Length and Transfer encoding header parsing. It is possible to conduct HTTP request smuggling attacks by sending the Content-Length header twice. Furthermore, invalid Transfer Encoding headers were found to be parsed as valid which could be leveraged for TE:CL smuggling attacks. Note: This project is deprecated, and is not maintained any more.

github.com/rubysec/ruby-advisory-db.title: HTTP Request Smuggling in reel

advisories.description: reel allows Request Smuggling attacks due to incorrect `Content-Length` and `Transfer-Encoding` header parsing. It is possible to conduct HTTP request smuggling attacks by sending the `Content-Length` header twice. Furthermore, invalid Transfer Encoding headers were found to be parsed as valid which could be leveraged for `TE:CL` smuggling attacks.
advisories.solution: Unfortunately, there is no solution available as this project has been deprecated.
advisories.title: Inconsistent Interpretation of HTTP Requests (HTTP Request Smuggling)

Note: This project is deprecated, and is not maintained any more.
